--000e0cd247d4397a0e046a6dd3ef
Content-Type: text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hello all.<br /><br />I have a situation here where I'm more or less st=
uck and appreciate your inputs. I have a Restfull infrastructure in place t=
hat allow us to expose resources like this:<br /><br />GET /employees/1234<=
br />---<br /><employee id=3D"1234"><br />    <name>T=
oni</name><br />    <function>analyst</function><br />   =
 <since>20080808</since><br /></employee><br /><br />Now =
I need to synchronize these resources with another application in a way tha=
t only changed fields are passing back and forward, that could be represent=
ed by formats like<br /><br /><update ref=3D"/employee/1234><br =
/>    <field id=3D"function"><br />        <old_value&gt=
;Analyst</old_value><br />        <new_value>Manager</new_va=
lue><br />    </field><br />    <field id=3D"since"&g=
t;<br />        <old_value>20080808</old_value><br />        &l=
t;new_value>20090909</new_value><br />    </field>   <br />&=
lt;/update><br /><br />This case seems simple enough, but things can be =
more complicated, as we may have to have atomic operations on more than one=
 resource, so instead of that example we can end up with something like<br =
/><br /><operations><br />    <operation type=3D"update"=
 ref=3D"/employee/1234"><br />        <field id=3D"fun=
ction"><br />            <old_value>Analyst</old_value>=
<br />            <new_value>Program Manager</new_value><br /> =
       </field><br />        <field id=3D"since"><br =
/>            <old_value>20080808</old_value><br />            =
<new_value>20090909</new_value><br />        </field>   <=
br />    </operation type=3D"delete" ref=3D"/employee/123=
4/assignments" /><br /></operations><br /><br />(none of this=
 formats are defined yet, it can be whatever we come up)<br /><br />Now non=
e of this seems to be Restfull, and our first guess was to use SyncML to ex=
change this kind of information. However, SyncML seems a overkill to me, an=
d since it has some principles that are restish (client-server, limited set=
 of verbs, mime-type) I was wonder how I could simplify the processing and =
turn it into something I can implement over our rest infrastructure.<br /><=
br />I also was wondering if things like micro-formats and/or protocols lik=
e Atom could be used to do such a thing, (I just found something called Fee=
dSync) but I don't have enough knowledge of them to tell.<br /><br />An=
y help will be very welcome, even if this is not a case for Rest...<br />__=
_____________________________________________<br /><br />Melhores cumprimen=
tos / Beir beannacht / Best regards<br /><br />Ant=F3nio Manuel dos Santos =
Mota<br />_______________________________________________
--000e0cd247d4397a0e046a6dd3ef--
